name: OpenShift S2I Community
body:
# Introduction

The OpenShift S2I Community contains community-maintained OpenShift Source-to-Image (S2I) builder images.  This provides a central repository for custom builder images, with the benefits of collaborative maintenance: for example, ensuring continuity of project maintenance in the event that you take a vacation or decide to stop working on the project.

Although this project is not directly affiliated with or supported by with [Red Hat](https://redhat.com), many of the [OpenShift Origin](https://www.openshift.org) maintainers also contribute here, so your project benefits from expert review.

# Guidelines

* All contributions MUST be submitted under a suitable open-source license to ensure legal redistribution.  We suggest the Apache License version 2, in order to guarantee compatibility with the OpenShift Origin project itself
* Copyrightable contributions SHOULD be accompanied with a statement stating compliance with the project license.  We suggest the built-in Git "sign-off" method using the Linux Foundation's [Developer Certificate of Origin](http://developercertificate.org/).  For further details, see [The most powerful contributor agreement]( https://lwn.net/Articles/592503/) and the description of the process for the Linux project: [Sign your work](https://kernel.org/doc/Documentation/SubmittingPatches)
